means: （因违反协议、犯规、受罚等）丧失，失去
罚金，没收物，丧失的东西

sentence.Network_en: He was ordered to forfeit more than £1.5m in profits.
sentence.Network_cn: 下令没收了他150多万英镑的盈利。

sentence.Network_en: That is the forfeit he must pay.
If you cancel your flight, you will forfeit your deposit.
sentence.Network_cn: 乘客取消航班订位，定金概不退还。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (originally denoting a crime or transgression, hence a fine or penalty for this): from Old French forfet, forfait, past participle of forfaire 'transgress', from for- 'out' (from Latin foris 'outside') + faire 'do' (from Latin facere)

entry.def: If you forfeit something, you lose it or are forced to give it up because you have broken a rule or done something wrong.

example.ex: He was ordered to forfeit more than £1.5m in profits...
example.tran: 下令没收了他 150 多万英镑的盈利。

example.ex: He argues that murderers forfeit their own right to life.
example.tran: 他辩称杀人犯本身已经丧失了生存的权利。

entry.def: If you forfeit something, you give it up willingly, especially so that you can achieve something else.

example.ex: He has forfeited a lucrative fee but feels his well-being is more important...
example.tran: 他主动放弃了可观的酬金，觉得自己的健康更加重要。

example.ex: Do you think that they would forfeit profit in the name of safety?
example.tran: 你认为他们会为了安全而放弃利润吗？

entry.def: A forfeit is something that you have to give up because you have done something wrong.

example.ex: That is the forfeit he must pay.

means.word_mean: 1. something that is lost or surrendered as a penalty;
2. a penalty for a fault or mistake that involves losing or giving up something;

sentences.sentence: "the contract specified forfeits if the work was not completed on time"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of losing or surrendering something as a penalty for a mistake or fault or failure to perform etc.
1. lose or lose the right to by some error, offense, or crime

auth_sentence.content: We forfeit our seed investment that way.

auth_sentence.res_content: But if you lose the bet, you'll forfeit everything.

sentences.en: You will forfeit your chance of getting your money if you are late.
sentences.cn: 如果你迟到, 就将失去取钱的机会。

jushi.chinese: 我们不能失去这个机会。

jushi.english: She forfeited her chance of entering the competition by not posting her form in time.
jushi.chinese: 她因为没有及时把表格寄去，从而丧失了参赛的机会。

jushi.english: If you lose the game,you will have to pay a forfeit.
jushi.chinese: 如果你输了比赛，就得受罚。
